soccerbot

Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • soccerbot.Navigation

  • public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Object
    Navigation is the class tasked with navigating the robot from coordinate to coordinate and alter its angle of orientation. Information required to process the functions of this class depend on information stored in the Odometer class.

    Only a single instance of both Navigation and Odometer should exist.

    Author:
    Nabil Chowdhury, Omar Akkila
    See Also:
    Odometer

    • Constructor Detail

      • Navigation

        public Navigation(Odometer odometer,
          USPoller left,
          USPoller right,
          EV3LargeRegulatedMotor leftMotor,
          EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor)
        This constructor assumes two EV3LargeRegualtedMotor objects and two ultrasonic sensors are linked to the brick. An Odometer to process navigation is required.
        Parameters:
        odometer - The odometer object used to retrieve coordinates and heading
        left - Left ultrasonic sensor
        right - Right ultrasonic sensor
        leftMotor - One of two EV3LargeRegulatedMotor objects passed to navigate the robot
        rightMOtor - Second EV3LargeRegualtedMotor object passed to navigate the robot

    • Method Detail

      • travelTo

        public void travelTo(double x,
            double y,
            boolean avoid)
        Travels to the specified coordinate (x, y). The current x and y positions of the robot is retrieved from the Odometer where the specified coordinates and the current coordinates are used to determine the correct heading the robot should face before attempting to travel to the desired coordinate.

        Once the current heading reported by the Odometer is within 0.04 degrees error, the robot will then begin its motion towards the desired coordinate until the distance between the polled coordinates grabbed from the Odometer and the desired coordinate is within 0.2 cm. The motors are then stopped.

        Parameters:
        x - X-position of the desired coordinate
        y - Y-position of the desired coordinate
        avoid - Perform obstacle avoidance when obstacles are expected if true.
        See Also:
        Odometer

      • turnTo

        public void turnTo(double theta)
        This method causes the robot to turn to absolute heading theta via a minimum angle
        Parameters:
        theta - Absolute angle from the y-axis to turn to
        See Also:
        Odometer

      • convertDistance

        private int convertDistance(double radius,
                  double distance)
        Convert absolute distance in cm into degrees the wheels are required based on the radius of the wheel to be rotated. Equation used is (180.0 * distance) / (pi * radius)
        Parameters:
        radius - Radius of wheel being rotated in cm
        distance - Absolute distance in cm
        Returns:
        Degrees wheel is required to rotate

      • goStraight

        public void goStraight(int lSpd,
              int rSpd,
              double distance)
        Travel in a straight line for a certain distance in cm.
        Parameters:
        lSpd - Speed of left motor
        rSpd - Speed of right motor
        distance - Distance in cm to be traveled

      • convertAngle

        private int convertAngle(double radius,
               double width,
               double angle)
        Convert absolute angle on place to degrees each wheel is required to turn based on the radius of the wheel to be rotated and the width of the robot. Through the angle and the width we can calculate the distance required to move using (width * angle) / 2.0
        Parameters:
        radius - Radius of wheel being rotated in cm
        width - Wheel-to-wheel distance measured in cm from the center of each wheel
        angle - Absolute angle to be rotated in radians
        Returns:
        Degrees wheel is required to rotate
        See Also:
        convertDistance(dobule radius, double distance)

      • angleToHeading

        private double angleToHeading(double x,
                    double y)
        Calculate the absolute angle to orient this robot toward the coordinate (x, y). This method is called in the travelTo method to orient this robot toward the desired coordinate before starting its motion toward it.
        Parameters:
        x - X-position of coordinate to turn to
        y - Y-position of coordinate to turn to
        Returns:
        Absolute angle to turn to relative to y-axis

      • turnTo

        public void turnTo(double x,
          double y)

      • setSpeeds

        public void setSpeeds(int leftSpeed,
             int rightSpeed,
             boolean move,
             int acceleration)
        Set the speeds of each motor and give the option on whether to move directly after setting.
        Parameters:
        leftSpeed - Speed of left motor
        rightSpeed - Speed of right motor
        move - Begin motion of motors if true otherwise do nothing
        acceleration - Acceleration value for each motor. Same value is used for both.

      • stopMotors

        public void stopMotors()

      • avoid

        private void avoid(double odoX,
         double odoY)
        Bang-bang style controller for obstacle avoidance.
        Parameters:
        odoX - Current x-value in cm reported by the odometer
        odoY - Current y-value in cm reported by the odometer
        See Also:
        Odometer, USPoller

        Prevent twitching in the motors

        Returns:
